item.title: Auto responder help
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

That part about oldline and newline, take that out. It will respond, and won’t detect that last thing anymore. And it’s not working because oldline and newline will always be the same.

item.title: Auto responder help
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Lol i added it soon after i posted my first post…
but it still doesnt work and this is my script now:

[scar]program New;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
procedure DeclarePlayers; //////
begin //////
HowManyPlayers := 1; // Set Number of Players here. //////
NumberOfPlayers(HowManyPlayers); // Sets the Players Array Length;//////
CurrentPlayer := 0; // CurrentPlayer = Array Index //////
//////
Players[0].Name := ‘—’; //Username //////
Players[0].Pass := ‘—’; //Password //////
Players[0].Nick := ‘—’; //3 or 4 letters username //////
Players[0].Loc := ’ ‘; //Leave as blank //////
Players[0].Skill := ‘mining’; //The skill for when you get a lamp //////
Players[0].Active := True; //////
//////
writeln(inttostr(HowManyPlayers) + ’ Players’); //////
end; //////
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

procedure antibanresponding;
begin
OldLine := TheLine;
TheName := lowercase(trim(GetTextAtEx(20, 415, 45, SmallChars, False, False, 0, 2, 0, 40, True, tr_NormalChars)));
TheLine := lowercase(trim(GetTextAtEx(20, 415, 45, SmallChars, False, False, 0, 2, 16711680, 40, False, tr_NormalChars)));
NewLine := TheLine;
if(OldLine <> NewLine)then

WriteFileString(TheFile,TheTime+’ '+ TheName + ‘’ + TheLine + chr(13));
if(inchat(‘wc’)) or (inchat(‘wcing’)) or (inchat(‘woodc’))or
(inchat(‘woodcutting’)) or (inchat(‘woodcuttin’)) and
(inchat(‘lvls’)) or (inchat(‘lvs’)) or (inchat(‘lvs’)) or
(inchat(‘levels’)) then
begin
gametab(2)
wait(1000+random(1000))
TypeSend(inttostr(getskilllevel(‘woodcutting’)));
end;

if(inchat((Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick)))then
begin
Case random(5) of
1: TypeSend(‘just let me work in peace gosh!!!’);
2: TypeSend(‘please leave me alone…’);
3: TypeSend(‘what?!?!?!’);
4: TypeSend(‘let me work in peace dangit!’);
5: TypeSend(‘you talking to me??’);
end;
end;

if(inchat((Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick)))and(inchat(‘friends’))then
begin
Case random(5) of
1: TypeSend(‘no’);
2: TypeSend(’-.-’);
3: TypeSend(‘i dont need friends…’);
4: TypeSend(‘just leave me alone.’);
5: TypeSend(‘i dont have time for friends’);
end;
end;
end;

begin
setupSRL;
declareplayers;
NickNameBMP := CreateBitmapMaskFromText(Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick, UpChars);
activateclient;
repeat
wait(2000)
antibanresponding;
until(false)
end.[/scar]

and this is what i get in the debug box like 30 times:
[scar]welcome to runescape.[/scar]
and this about 15 times, witch is an account saying my accounts name:
[scar]bbity2:[/scar]

im really confused.
~jR

Read full topic

item.title: Auto responder help
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Try running it, then clicking on the screen. I have a feeling that the typing is targeted on the debug.

EDIT: Oh and add ActivateClient as the first thing in your main loop. Make sure you targeted the screen with the crosshair though. That should fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto responder help
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

This is what i have and when i run this on the RS screen it doesnt do anything but write stuff in the debug box…
I dont know how to fix this so i came to you guys for some help.

[scar]program New;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
procedure DeclarePlayers; //////
begin //////
HowManyPlayers := 1; // Set Number of Players here. //////
NumberOfPlayers(HowManyPlayers); // Sets the Players Array Length;//////
CurrentPlayer := 0; // CurrentPlayer = Array Index //////
//////
Players[0].Name := ‘BLANK’; //Username //////
Players[0].Pass := ‘BLANK’; //Password //////
Players[0].Nick := ‘BLANK’; //3 or 4 letters username //////
Players[0].Loc := ’ ‘; //Leave as blank //////
Players[0].Skill := ‘mining’; //The skill for when you get a lamp //////
Players[0].Active := True; //////
//////
writeln(inttostr(HowManyPlayers) + ’ Players’); //////
end; //////
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

procedure antibanresponding;
begin
OldLine := TheLine;
TheName := lowercase(trim(GetTextAtEx(20, 415, 45, SmallChars, False, False, 0, 2, 0, 40, True, tr_NormalChars)));
TheLine := lowercase(trim(GetTextAtEx(20, 415, 45, SmallChars, False, False, 0, 2, 16711680, 40, False, tr_NormalChars)));
NewLine := TheLine;
if(OldLine <> NewLine)then

if(inchat(‘wc’)) or (inchat(‘wcing’)) or (inchat(‘woodc’))or
(inchat(‘woodcutting’)) or (inchat(‘woodcuttin’)) and
(inchat(‘lvls’)) or (inchat(‘lvs’)) or (inchat(‘lvs’)) or
(inchat(‘levels’)) then
begin
gametab(2)
wait(1000+random(1000))
TypeSend(inttostr(getskilllevel(‘woodcutting’)));
end;

if(inchat((Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick)))then
begin
Case random(5) of
1: TypeSend(‘just let me work in peace gosh!!!’);
2: TypeSend(‘please leave me alone…’);
3: TypeSend(‘what?!?!?!’);
4: TypeSend(‘let me work in peace dangit!’);
5: TypeSend(‘you talking to me??’);
end;
end;

if(inchat((Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick)))and(inchat(‘friends’))then
begin
Case random(5) of
1: TypeSend(‘no!’);
2: TypeSend(’-.-’);
3: TypeSend(‘i dont need friends…’);
4: TypeSend(‘just leave me alone.’);
5: TypeSend(‘i dont have time for friends’);
end;
end;
end;

begin
setupSRL;
declareplayers;
NickNameBMP := CreateBitmapMaskFromText(Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick, UpChars);
repeat
wait(2000)
antibanresponding;
until(false)
end.[/scar]

The reason why I put it in a procedure like this is because if it worked I would of included it in one of my scripts.
HELP
~jR

Read full topic
